[[File:American Association for Women Radiologists (logo).png|right|thumb|The AAWR logo]]
The '''American Association for Women Radiologists''' (or '''AAWR''') is a [[professional association]] founded in 1981 as a resource for "professional socialization" for women in a male-dominated field of [[radiology]].
AAWR’s role model is [[Marie Curie]], extraordinary scientist, mother and teacher.
The main goals of the association were to provide a forum for issues unique to women in radiology, [[radiation oncology]] and related professions, to sponsor programs that promote opportunities for women, and to facilitate networking among women radiologists.
==External links== * [http://www.aawr.org/ AAWR]

{{For|the figure skater|Candace Jones}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Candy Jones | image = Candy Jones 2.jpg | caption = Candy Jones in ''[[Yank, the Army Weekly|Yank]]'' magazine, 1945 | birth_date = {{Birth date|1925|12|31}} | birth_place = [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1990|01|18|1925|12|31}} | death_place = [[Manhattan]], New York City | other_names = Jessica Arline Wilcox | known_for = Modelling and media work, claimed to be a victim of [[Project MKULTRA]] | occupation = [[Pin-up girl]], fashion model, author, [[Talk radio|radio talk show]] hostess | nationality = USA }} '''Candy Jones''', originally known as '''Jessica Arline Wilcox''' (December 31, 1925 – January 18, 1990), was an American fashion model, writer and [[Talk radio|radio talk show]] hostess. Born in [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]], she was raised and educated in [[Atlantic City, New Jersey]].{{cite news | last = Flint | first = PB | url = https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C0CE3D61739F93AA25752C0A966958260 | title = Candy Jones Dies; Ex-Model, Teacher, And Writer Was 64 | work = [[The New York Times]] | date = January 19, 1990 | accessdate = April 16, 2009 }} In the 1940s and 1950s, she was a leading model and [[pin-up girl]], and afterward, established a modeling school and wrote several books on modeling and fashion. In 1972, Jones married the popular radio show host [[Long John Nebel]] (he was her second husband), and became the co-host of his all-night talk-show on [[WMCA (AM)|WMCA]] in New York City. The show dealt with [[paranormal]], [[UFO]], and [[conspiracy theory]] claims. Jones controversially claimed to be a victim of [[Project MKULTRA]], the [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]] mind-control program, in the 1960s. ==Biography== ===Early life and career=== Candy Jones was born to a well-off family. Jones reported vivid, conscious memories of [[physical abuse]] by her parents and vague memories of sexual abuse in her youth.Bain, Donald. (1976)''The Control of Candy Jones'', Chicago: Playboy Press. She was shuttled among relatives, and her mother, Jones insisted, often kept her cloistered or locked in dark rooms. As a child, Jones said she had an imaginary friend named Arlene to help through her lonely episodes. Jones grew into an attractive, statuesque young woman, about {{convert|6|ft|4|in|m|abbr=on}}.{{cite web | url = http://www.forteantimes.com/features/profiles/497/candy_jones.html | title = Candy Jones: How a leading American fashion model came to be experimented upon by the CIA mind control team | last = Bennett | first = C | date = July 1, 2001 | accessdate = October 16, 2008 | work = [[Fortean Times]] | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20081006205250/http://forteantimes.com/features/profiles/497/candy_jones.html | archivedate = October 6, 2008 | df = mdy-all }} Changing her name, she pursued a career as a fashion model. She was a quick success, becoming a runner up for [[Miss New Jersey]] in the [[Miss America]] contest. Jones was able to parlay this into a hostess job at the main Miss America contest, and a successful career. She was one of the leading pin-up girls of the [[World War II]] era: In one month in 1943, she appeared on 11 magazine covers. During a lengthy [[United Service Organizations]] (USO) tour in the [[Philippines]], Jones fell ill in 1945, and was treated by a doctor who was still alive when Candy publicised her mind-control claims; [[Donald Bain (writer)|Donald Bain]] gave this doctor the alias "Gilbert Jensen". According to researcher Martin Cannon,{{cite web | url=http://www.constitution.org/abus/controll.htm | title=The Controllers: A new hypothesis of Alien Abduction | publisher=[[Constitution Society]] | accessdate=December 9, 2016 | author=Cannon, Martin}} who interviewed Jones before she died in 1990, the "Marshall Burger" alias in Bain's book who worked with Jensen on the Jones case was actually Dr. [[William S. Kroger]], a psychologist at one time associated with [[UCLA]]. ===First marriage=== In 1946, Jones married fashion czar [[Harry Conover]], one of the first model agents. They had three sons, and Jones says she didn't realize Conover was bisexual until some years into their marriage. She recognized some people might consider this naive, but Jones insisted her abusive childhood had made her wary of intimate relationships, and though she had many suitors, she was sexually inexperienced when she married. She reported that Conover initiated sexual activities with her very few times, and only when he was intoxicated. Without notice, Conover disappeared in late 1958. Jones notified police, and Conover's absence made the news. When he returned after a long binge, Jones sued for divorce in 1959. After the divorce, she was left with $36, and considerable debts.[http://www.secretdonttell.com/history/candy/ Candy Jones page] at www.secretdonttell.com Jones opened a modeling school, and she began appearing regularly on NBC's weekend radio news program ''[[Monitor (NBC Radio)|Monitor]]''. ===Second marriage and radio career=== On December 31, 1972, Jones married radio host [[Long John Nebel]] after a one-month courtship; they briefly met decades earlier when Nebel was a photographer. Jones was soon the regular co-host of Nebel's popular overnight radio talk show, which usually discussed various [[paranormal]] topics. ===Mind-control claims=== Shortly after their marriage, Nebel said, he noted that Jones exhibited violent mood swings, and at times, seemed to display a different personality. Nebel called this "The Voice ... a look, a few moments of bitchiness." 'The Voice' usually vanished rather quickly, but the change was so drastic from Jones's usually pleasant demeanor that Nebel was startled and distressed. Colin Bennett writes,
A few weeks after their marriage, [Jones] did tell Nebel that she had worked for the [[FBI]] for some time, adding mysteriously that she might have to go out of town on occasion without giving a reason. This left Nebel wondering whether there was a connection between the 'other' personality within Candy and the strange trips she said she made for the FBI.
Nebel began [[hypnosis|hypnotising]] Jones, and uncovered an [[multiple personality disorder|alternate personality]] named "Arlene". Under hypnosis, Jones related a lengthy, elaborate account of her being trained in a [[CIA]] [[mind-control]] program, often at west coast colleges and universities. Jones and Nebel eventually recorded hundreds of hours of these hypnotic sessions.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} Jones said she had some conscious memories of her involvement in the mind-control program: it began in 1960, she said, when an old USO acquaintance (an unnamed retired army general) asked to use Jones' modeling school as a mailing address to receive some letters and packages. Jones agreed, she said, out of a sense of patriotism. Eventually, said Jones, she was asked to deliver a letter to Oakland, California on a business trip she had scheduled. Again, Jones reported she agreed, and was surprised to discover the letter was delivered to the same Dr. Jensen who had treated her in the Philippines nearly two decades earlier. Jones said that Jensen and his associate, Dr. "Marshall Burger" (another alias) offered hefty amounts of cash if she was willing to engage in further plans; in their earlier meetings, Jensen had noted that Jones was an ideal subject for hypnosis. Jones agreed, she said, because her modeling school was faltering, and she wanted to keep her sons in their costly private schools. During hypnosis sessions, an alternate personality called "Arlene" was reportedly groomed by Jensen, so that Jones would have no memory of Arlene's activities. Jones allegedly made trips to locations as far away as Taiwan. While hypnotized, Jones claimed that she was subjected to painful torture in order to test the effectiveness of the alternate personality. Donald Bain writes, "[Jones] would be a messenger for the agency in conjunction with her normal business trips." Again with the USO, Jones visited South Vietnam in 1970; she later suspected her visit had some connection to a disastrous attempt to free American [[prisoners of war]] from North Vietnam. Jones's and Nebel's claims were first made public in 1976 (in [[Donald Bain (writer)|Donald Bain]]'s ''The Control of Candy Jones'', published by [[Playboy|Playboy Press]]). Nebel apparently accepted his wife's claims, and openly discussed killing Dr. Jensen in revenge. However, Nebel was a prankster and a hoaxer of long standing and as he was not above hoaxing his radio audience, some of whom doubted the recovered memories of Candy Jones's past were genuine. Later skeptics{{Who|date=October 2009}} would argue that an alleged [[false memory syndrome]] was a more plausible explanation. Several years later, Jones' story gained more notice after the public disclosure of [[MK-ULTRA]] in 1977. Bain reported that associates in Jones' modeling schools asserted that Jones indeed had some puzzling absences – supposed business trips where little or no business seemed to be conducted. Bain also writes that another piece of evidence came forth when "Candy inadvertently held onto a passport of 'Arlene Grant': Candy in a dark wig and dark makeup". Jones says she had no memory of dressing in such an outfit or of posing for a passport in a different name. Bain also claimed that a tape-recorded message on an answering machine was left on Jones and Nebel's home telephone number on July 3, 1973:
This is [[Japan Airlines]] calling on oh-three July at 4.10 p.m. ... Please have Miss Grant call 759-9100 ... she is holding a reservation on Japan Airlines Flight 5 for the sixth of July, [[John F. Kennedy International Airport|Kennedy]] to Tokyo, with an option on to Taipei. This is per Cynthia that we are calling.
When Jones telephoned the number and asked for Cynthia, she was told that no one of that name worked at the reservations desk. Additionally, Brian Haughton notes that
There was also a letter [Jones] wrote to her attorney, William Williams, to cover herself in case she died or disappeared suddenly or under unusual circumstances; she told him she was not at liberty to reveal exactly what she was involved in. Bain wrote to Williams who corroborated this fact.[http://www.mysteriouspeople.com/Candy_Jones.htm A brief history of Candy Jones as spy "Arlene Grant"]
Bain also notes that in 1971, an article by hypnosis expert [[George Estabrooks]] was published in ''[[Science Digest]]'', wherein Estabrooks openly discussed the successful creation of amnesiac couriers of the type Jones claimed to have been.[http://www.mindspring.com/~txporter/scidig.htm Hypnosis Comes of Age], [[George Estabrooks]], ''[[Science Digest]]'', April 1971 Dr. [[Herbert Spiegel]], a nationally recognized hypnosis expert, wrote the foreword to ''The Control of Candy Jones''. Candy Jones is the subject of the [[Exit Clov]] song "MK ULTRA." The story of her mind-control claims was featured in an episode of ''[[Dark Matters: Twisted But True]]'' in a segment entitled "Sexy Secret Agent". ==Death== Jones died of cancer on January 18, 1990 at Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 64 years old and had been living in Manhattan. ==Books by Jones== *''Make Your Name in Modeling and Television'', [[Harper and Brothers]], 1960 *''Between Us Girls'' [[Harper and Row]], 1966 *''Just for Teens '', Harper and Row, 1967 *''Modeling and Other Glamour Careers'', Harper and Row, 1969{{cite web|title=Modeling and other glamour careers|url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/modeling-and-other-glamour-careers/oclc/448840&referer=brief_results|accessdate=November 8, 2011}} *''Candy Jones' Complete Book of Beauty and Fashion'', Harper and Row, 1976 *''More Than Beauty: A Behind-the-Scenes Look at the Modeling World'', Harper and Row, 1970 ==See also== *[[:Category:Remote viewing|Remote viewing]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ;Bibliography *Bain, Donald. ''The Control of Candy Jones'', Playboy Press, Chicago, 1976. ==External links== {{Commons category}} * {{IMDb name|3226617}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jones, Candy}} [[Category:Female models from Pennsylvania]] [[Category:American talk radio hosts]] [[Category:Women radio presenters]] [[Category:Writers from Atlantic City, New Jersey]] [[Category:Writers from Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Hypnosis]] [[Category:1925 births]] [[Category:1990 deaths]] [[Category:Mind control]] [[Category:Project MKUltra]]

[[Petroleum]] | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = Over 1000 | homepage = [http://www.challengerlimited.com challenger.com] }} '''Challenger Ltd''' is a provider of contract [[oil]] and [[gas]] land drilling and [[workover]] services. ==History== Challenger is based in the [[Middle East]] and [[North Africa]] (MENA) region, and is currently led by [[Chairman]] [[Hassan Tatanaki]].''Gulf Financiers Seek to Invest in Libya'', Africa Intelligence The company was founded in 1991 and operated first in [[Africa]] later expanding into the [[Middle East]]. ==Operations== Challenger Limited is a provider of contract oil and gas land [[well drilling]] and work over services. The company owns and operates 25 [[drilling rigs]] in [[Libya]] providing drilling and work-over services for oil, gas, and [[water wells]], with offices in Egypt, [[Saudi Arabia]] and the [[United Arab Emirates]]. Workover refers to any kind of oil [[well intervention]] involving invasive techniques, such as [[Slickline|wireline]], [[coiled tubing]] or [[snubbing]]. More specifically though, it will refer to the expensive process of pulling and replacing a [[Completion (oil well)]]. It has an extensive client base, including several [[national oil company|national oil companies]] as well as international corporations such as [[Agip]]/[[Eni]], [[Total S.A.|Total]], [[Marathon Oil]], [[Veba]] and Verenex Energy. Challenger works as a regular subcontractor to the state-owned [[National Oil Corporation]] of Libya. Challenger is one of the oldest drilling companies in Africa, and particularly in Libya. Since inception, the company has grown every year producing impressive financial results. Challenger is a private company limited by shares registered in the General Registry of the [[Isle of Man]], G.B. It operates as a commercial entity through a network of branches in [[Liechtenstein]], the Middle East and Africa.Silicon Valley-San Jose Business Journal: Challenger profile Financial Consultants and [[audit]] firms include [[KPMG]] and [[PriceWaterhouseCoopers]]. ===Products and Services=== [[File:Workoverrig.jpg|A workover rig.|thumb|200px]] *Challenger - 14 OIME SL-7 *Challenger - 19 National 80-B Trailerized *Challenger - 23 IRI- CABOT-900-Truck Mounted *[[Kenworth]] Trucks - (953-50 Ton, C500-35 Ton and Foremost Delta-3) *Trucks & Trailers - (Mercedes, Nissan Patrol, [[Toyota Land Cruiser]], Toyota Pickup and MAN) *[[Oshkosh Corporation|Oshkosh]] Trucks *Loaders - ([[Caterpillar Inc.|Caterpillar]] & [[Volvo]]) *Excavators - (Caterpillar -D7) ==VC Bank Acquisition== In 2006, [[Venture Capital Bank]] (VC Bank), a [[Bahrain]]-based [[investment bank]], along with its partner, the U.S. private equity firm [[Global Emerging Markets]] (GEM), acquired a significant stake in Challenger. The acquisition cost roughly $50 million and was co-financed by VC Bank and GEM. This transaction demonstrated that the MENA region contains several attractive, yet obscured, investment opportunities represented in [[privately held companies]] such as Challenger.[http://www.rigzone.com/news/article.asp?a_id=38374 ''VC Bank Acquires Stake in Challenger''], VC Bank, Nov. 21, 2006 The investment is beneficial to both parties, allowing Challenger to achieve its growth plan and helping VC Bank to achieve its objectives of supporting companies in the MENA region. Challenger Chairman Hassan Tatanaki said that "amongst alternative financing routes available, Challenger's management decided to partner with VC Bank and GEM to fuel and expedite its capacity expansion plans and its geographical coverage." Tatanaki added that "in the oil sector, with Libya in particular, oil production in the 1970s was more than 3 million bpd compared to today's levels of 1.6 million bpd. With proven [[oil reserves]] of {{convert|41.5|Goilbbl|m3|abbr=on}} of mainly sweet [[light crude oil]] in January 2007, an aggressive plan has been introduced by the Libyan government to enhance production capabilities to 3 million bpd by 2010. Since the lifting of [[International sanctions|sanctions]], exploration concessions have been granted to international exploration companies, which hope to drill 50 exploration wells per year." VC Bank [[CEO]] Abdullatif Mohammed Janahi added, “our investment in Challenger will help the company snatch the exceptional growth potential in Libya and enter international markets. Soaring oil prices have brought about a supply/demand imbalance of oil rigs worldwide, leading oil and gas companies to spend more on exploration and production. This has, in turn, increased demand for oil drilling contractors such as Challenger.” ===Challenger Limited: Selected Clients=== {| class="wikitable" ! Client !! Years of Operation !! {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Chinese name|[[Wang (surname)|Wang 王]]}} {{Infobox person | name = Cher Wang | image = Cher Wang in WEF.jpg | image_size = 180px | image_meaning = World Economic Forum | caption = HTC CEO Cher Wang shows new mobile phone motherboard at the [[World Economic Forum]] on January 23, 2008 | chinesename = | tradchinesename = 王雪紅 | simpchinesename = 王雪红 | pinyinchinesename = Wáng Xuěhóng | birth_date = {{nowrap|{{birth date and age|df=yes|1958|9|14|}}}} | death_date = | death_place = | body_discovered = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = Taiwanese | citizenship = {{ROC}} | other_names = | known_for = Contributions to HTC and VIA; creating a fairly early model of smart phones in 1997 | education = [[University of California, Berkeley|UC Berkeley]], 1981 | alma_mater = | employer = [[HTC]], [[VIA Technologies]] | occupation = Entrepreneur | years_active = 1997-present | home_town = [[Taipei]], Taiwan | property = 2.0 billion (with husband) | networth = US$1.1 billion | party = | opponents = | religion = | spouse = [[Chen Wen-Chi]] | children = | parents = [[Wang Yung-ching]]
Jiao Yang | relations = Cherlin Wang | callsign = | awards = Forbes World's Billionaires list, 2010, 2011, 2012; Forbes World's Most Powerful Women list, 2012, 2014 | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Cher Wang''' ({{zh|t=王雪紅|p=Wáng Xuěhóng}}; born 15 September 1958) is a [[Taiwanese people|Taiwanese]] [[entrepreneur]] and [[philanthropist]] born in [[Taipei]], [[Taiwan]]. As co-founder and chairperson (since 2007{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=6310859&ticker=2498:TT&previousCapId=8104897&previousTitle=HTC+CORP|title=Executive Profile: Cher Wang|publisher=Businessweek|accessdate=5 March 2013}}) of [[HTC Corporation]] (which manufactured one out of every six smartphones sold in the [[United States]]) and integrated chipset maker [[VIA Technologies]]. She is considered one of the most powerful and successful women in technology.{{cite web|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/women-in-tech/2011/executives/cher-wang|title= Most Influential Women in Technology 2011 - Cher Wang|publisher=FastCompany|accessdate=10 January 2013}} Wang's father was [[Wang Yung-ching]],{{cite news |last=Kovac|first=Matt|url= http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/05_28/b3942425.htm |title=Taiwan's Priestess of The PDA |accessdate=2008-08-08 |work= |publisher=Business Week |date= 2005-07-11}} founder of the plastics and petrochemicals conglomerate [[Formosa Plastics Group]] and one of the wealthiest individuals in Taiwan before his death in 2008.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/10/17/business/17wang.html|title=Wang, Billionaire who led Formosa Plastic death at 91|publisher=The New york Times|accessdate=27 July 2014}} As of 2014, she is listed as the 54th most powerful woman in the world by ''Forbes''.{{cite web|title=The World's 100 Most Powerful Women|url=https://www.forbes.com/power-women/list/2/#tab:overall|website=Forbes|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=26 June 2014}} ==Education== Wang studied abroad at [[The College Preparatory School]] in [[Oakland, California]], and went on to receive her bachelor's degree in economics{{cite news |title=Strain on HTC From Apple Suit Is Likely to Be Long-Term |first=Jonathan |last=Adams |newspaper=New York Times |date= 2010-03-03 |accessdate=2010-03-03 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/04/technology/04htc.html?hpw}} from the [[University of California, Berkeley]] in 1981. ==Career== She joined [[First International Computer]] (FIC) in 1982. Wang and others founded VIA in 1987 and HTC in 1997. In May 2011, [[Forbes]] ranked her with husband Wen Chi Chen as the wealthiest person in Taiwan, with a net worth of US$8.8 billion.{{cite news |url= https://blogs.forbes.com/russellflannery/2011/05/25/taiwans-40-richest |title=Taiwan’s 40 Richest |accessdate=2011-05-25 |work= |publisher=Forbes |date= 2011-05-25 |first=Russell |last=Flannery}} In August 2012, Wang was named #56 on Forbes' list of The World's 100 Most Powerful Women.{{cite news| url=https://www.forbes.com/power-women/list/| title= The World's 100 Most Powerful Women | date=2012-08-22 | accessdate=2013-01-15| work=Forbes}} As of 2014, she is listed as the 54th most powerful woman in the world by ''Forbes''. In Oct. 2014, Cher Wang refused to accept the Final Award of the "HKIAC / A11022 arbitration" and appealed to the Hong Kong High Court (Case No.:HCCT40 / 2014) before Judge Mimmie Chan. Wang asserted that the Award was contrary to public policy. VIA product VT3421, an anti-hack chip (also named asTF376) was suspected in assisting the Chinese government of surveilling mobile devices of anti-communist and human rights activists. VIA executive Li Shaolun (Steven S. Lee) admitted in the proceedings that VIA chips did have "back door". The Hong Kong HKIAC sentenced VIA with compensation.{{cite news|url=http://www.appledaily.com.tw/realtimenews/article/new/20141210/521320/|title=VIA and Falungon |work=One Magazine (Chinese)}}{{Clarify|date=November 2017}} In a hearing before the Justice Mimmie Chan, in the High Court of Hong Kong, she{{who|date=May 2017}} said she believed the Award was in violation of Hong Kong's public order and morals. In June 2015 in she remised the case back to Arbitrator Anthony Neoh. The tribunal upheld the conviction in October 2015, and VIA lost the case for millions of dollars.{{cite news|url=https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/via-corporate/via-financials/taiwan/annual/VIA+annual+report+2015.pdf|title= VIA Annual Report |work=VIA}} The backdoor of hacking prevention chip VT3421/TF376 cause big issues in Taiwan. 11 Legislative Senators made suggestion to suspend the government procurement of hTC related communication products until the VIA Electronics' VT3421/TF376 hacking control chip backdoor issue should be thoroughly investigated by National Security Bureau and National Communication Committee. {{cite Taiwan Legislative House Report Volume 103 No. 89 |url=https://lci.ly.gov.tw/LyLCEW/communique1/final/pdf//103/89/LCIDC01_1038901_00018.pdf| publisher= Legislative Yuan Bulletin Volume 103 No. 89 Meeting Record| date=2014-12-19 }} In March 2015, Cher Wang took over the CEO role from Peter Chou and returned to the day-to-day operations of HTC.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-03-20/htc-chairwoman-cher-wang-takes-over-ceo-role-from-peter-chou-i7h8lj38|title=HTC Chairwoman Cher Wang Takes Over CEO Role From Peter Chou|date=2015-03-20|work=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2017-09-21}} In September 2017, HTC and Google announced a US$1.1 billion cooperation agreement, which involved certain HTC employees would join Google, and Google would receive HTC IP through a non-exclusive licensing agreement.{{Cite web|url=https://www.htc.com/us/about/newsroom/2017/2017-09-21-htc-google/|title=Google and HTC Announce US$1.1 Billion Cooperation Agreement|last=|first=|date=September 21, 2017|website=www.htc.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=September 21, 2017}} Wang’s Charity Foundations are holding eight investment companies’ stocks with market value of over US$200 millions. However, only US$ twenty-seven thousand has been donated to charity(0.000135%).{{cite news|url=http://www.new7.com.tw/NewsView.aspx?i=TXT20160406164208CLP|title= False Charity|work=New7}} Wang suited the reporter with anger and failed the case on Feb. 2018. {{Cite news|url= http://hanreporter.blogspot.com/2018/03/blog-post_46.html|title=HTC Chairwoman Cher Wang failed to reporter Yao }} ==Philanthropy== In 2011 Wang donated US$28.1 million to help found [[Guizhou]] Forerunner College, a charitable college in southwest China set up by VIA Technologies' non-profit Faith-Hope-Love Foundation. {{cite news| last=Cheng-yen| first=Han| url=http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20110924000084&cid=1104| title=HTC's Cher Wang opens vocational school in Guizhou| publisher=Want China Times| date=2011-09-24| accessdate=2013-01-15| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130217002905/http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20110924000084&cid=1104| archivedate=17 February 2013| df=dmy-all}} The not-for-profit college aims to provide three years of free or low-cost education to students from low-income families. Wang has stated that if the college proves successful she may well set up additional similar institutions in other parts of the country. Wang has also made significant donations to the [[University of California, Berkeley]], including funding to support and enhance the prestigious American Physical Society's Oliver E. Buckley Condensed Matter Prize, given to researchers who make considerable contributions to the field of [[condensed-matter physics]]. {{cite news |url=http://www.aps.org/publications/apsnews/201211/buckleyprize.cfm |title=Buckley Prize Receives Major Donation from Taiwanese Company | publisher=APS News |date= November 2012 | accessdate=2013-01-15}} Wang and Chen also provide funding to support a collaborative program between the psychology departments at UC Berkeley and [[Tsinghua University]] in [[Beijing]]. {{cite news| last=Anwar| first=Yasmin| url=http://newscenter.berkeley.edu/2010/07/15/happiness/| title=UC Berkeley psychologists bring science of happiness to China | publisher=US Berkeley News Center | date=2010-07-15 | accessdate=2013-01-15}} The Berkeley-Tsinghua Program for the Advanced Study in Psychology aims to create and support collaborative, psychological research between faculty and students from both universities. In August 2012 Wang donated 6,000 HTC Flyer tablet PCs to 60 [[Education in Taiwan|high school]]s in Taipei.{{cite news | url=http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20120824000077&cid=1103 | title=HTC's Cher Wang ranked 56th on Forbes' list of powerful women | publisher=Want China Times | date=2012-08-24 | accessdate=2013-01-17 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130704003636/http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20120824000077&cid=1103 | archivedate=4 July 2013 | df=dmy-all }} == Personal life == Wang is an avid philanthropist who says she prefers to stay out of the limelight despite her many accomplishments. She has begun to insert herself in Taiwan politics, however, by supporting Taiwan President [[Ma Ying-jeou]] in his bid for re-election[http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/7e4b45bc-3eb3-11e1-9139-00144feab49a.html#axzz2srsRHX51 "Ma Ying-jeou wins Taiwan election,"] Financial Times, January 14, 2012 and by voicing her support for the [[1992 Consensus]].[http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20120114000041&cid=1601 "I back 1992 Consensus as a true Taiwanese, says HTC's Cher Wang,"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221223929/http://www.wantchinatimes.com/news-subclass-cnt.aspx?id=20120114000041&cid=1601 |date=21 February 2014 }} Want China Times, January 14, 2012 Her husband is [[Wen Chi Chen]], the [[CEO]] of [[VIA Technologies]]. Wang is Christian. She has two children.{{cite news| last=Holson| first=Laura| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/10/27/technology/companies/27wang.html| title=With Smartphones, Cher Wang Made Her Own Fortune | publisher= The New York Times | date= 2008-10-26 | accessdate=2008-10-29}} == References == {{Reflist|33em}} == External links == * {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110520195641/http://members.forbes.com/global/2006/0109/045A.html |date=20 May 2011 |title=Companies, People, Ideas: Cher Dividend }}, Forbes. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110721035251/http://www.corpasia.net/taiwan/2498/irwebsite/index.php?secmod=directors&version=e&mod=directorsdetail&id=1 HTC Profile] * [http://www.urisov.com/htc/ HTC Corporation] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wang, Cher}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Taiwanese billionaires]] [[Category:Taiwanese people of Hoklo descent]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley alumni]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Taipei]] [[Category:Members of Committee of 100]] [[Category:Women in technology]] [[Category:Women company founders]] [[Category:Women business executives]] [[Category:Chief executives in the technology industry]] [[Category:Taiwanese Christians]] [[Category:Taiwanese company founders]] [[Category:Taiwanese women in business]] [[Category:Taiwanese chief executives]] [[Category:20th-century Taiwanese businesspeople]] [[Category:21st-century Taiwanese businesspeople]] [[Category:20th-century businesswomen]] [[Category:21st-century businesswomen]]

{{Infobox person | name = Corinna E. Lathan | image = | nationality = American | alma_mater = [[Swarthmore College]]
[[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]] | occupation = Health Care Entrepreneur
Engineer
Neuroscientist | title = CEO and Board Chair of [[AnthroTronix]] }} '''Corinna E. Lathan''' is an American entrepreneur, engineer, and social activist. She is the Chief Executive Officer, Co-Founder, and Board Chair of [[AnthroTronix|AnthroTronix, Inc.]], a biomedical research and development company headquartered in [[Silver Spring, Maryland]], USA. Lathan is recognized for her work on digital health software and assistive technology.{{cite news | url = http://www.wskc.org/thoughtleader-cori-lathan | title = Leading the Way | date = July 2012 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''Women in Engineering Proactive Network, Knowledge Center'' | author = Peggy Layne}} == Education == Lathan received her B.A. in Biopsychology and Mathematics from [[Swarthmore College]] in [[Swarthmore, Pennsylvania]] and an S.M. in Aeronautics and Astronautics and Ph.D. in Neuroscience from [[MIT]] in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]].{{cite news | url = https://bulletin.swarthmore.edu/bulletin-issue-archive/archive_p=849.html | title = Cori the Explorer | date = April 2002 | accessdate = 28 November 2017 | publisher = ''Swarthmore College'' | author = Christopher Maier}} == Career == Prior to founding [[AnthroTronix]], Lathan was an Associate Professor of Biomedical Engineering at [[Catholic University of America|The Catholic University of America]] and an Adjunct Associate Professor of Aerospace Engineering at the [[University of Maryland, College Park]].{{cite news | url = https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2001/0514/216.html#17d7f0e57016 | title = Robo-Therapy | date = 14 May 2001 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''Forbes''}} In 1999, Lathan co-founded [[AnthroTronix|AnthroTronix, Inc.]], a research and development company in Silver Spring, Maryland. In 2005, she founded AT KidSystems, Inc., a spinoff of [[AnthroTronix]], which distributes alternative computer interfaces and educational software.{{Cite news|url=|title=Women Who Mean Business 2007|last=Darcy|first=Darlene|date=November 30, 2007|work=Washington Business Journal|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|last2=Gaynair|first2=Gillian|page=5|last3=Plumb|first3=Tierney}} At [[AnthroTronix]], Lathan spearheaded the development of biomedical assistive devices such as CosmoBot, an interactive robot serving children with autism and with disorders that affect the nervous system.{{cite news | url = https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2009/11/02/robots-that-care | title = Robots That Care | date = 9 November 2009 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''The New Yorker''}} Most recently, she led the development of Defense Automated Neurobehavioral Assessment ([http://www.danabrainvital.com/ DANA]), an FDA-cleared digital health platform which helps healthcare providers better assess [[Cognition|cognitive function]].{{cite news | url = http://www.mobihealthnews.com/37507/fda-clears-military-tested-ptsd-brain-injury-diagnostic-app | title = FDA clears military-tested PTSD, brain injury assessment app | date = 20 October 2014 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''mobihealthnews''}} Lathan’s work with children with disabilities and robotics has been featured in magazines including [[Forbes]], [[Time (magazine)|Time]],{{cite news|url=|title=Global Business: To Your Health|last=Halper|first=Mark|date=15 December 2013|work=Time|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|publisher=|page=A8}} and [[The New Yorker]]. She was named as Maryland's Top Innovator of the Year,{{cite web| url = http://thedailyrecord.com/innovator-of-the-year/winners/2002-winners/ | title = 2002 Winners | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''The Daily Record''}} [[MIT Technology Review]]’s “Top 100 World Innovators,”{{cite web| url = https://www.technologyreview.com/s/401472/2002-tr100/ | title = 2002 TR100 | date = 1 June 2002 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''MIT Technology Review''}} and one of [[Fast Company (magazine)|Fast Company Magazine]]’s “Most Creative People in Business,”{{cite web| url = https://www.fastcompany.com/person/corinna-lathan | title = Corinna Lathan, Most Creative People 2010 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''Fast Company''}} among other recognitions. == Outreach == Lathan serves as co-chair of [[World Economic Forum]]’s Global Futures Council on [[Human enhancement|Human Enhancement]],{{cite web| url = https://www.weforum.org/communities/the-future-of-human-enhancement | title = The Future of Human Enhancement | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''World Economic Forum''}} a Board Member for the Smithsonian Institute's Lemelson Center for the Study of Invention and Innovation,{{Cite journal|last=|first=|date=January 2018|title=Corinna E. Lathan: A Catalyst who Enhances Interaction between Technology and People|url=http://www.insightssuccess.com/corinna-e-lathan-catalyst-enhances-interaction-technology-people/|journal=Insights Success|volume=|pages=|access-date=January 30, 2018|via=}} and a Board Member at [[Engineering World Health]], supporting the emergence of healthcare technology in the developing world.{{cite web| url = http://www.ewh.org/about/board | title = Board of Directors | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''Engineering World Health''}} She also serves as an Independent Director at [[PTC (software company)|PTC]], a global technology provider for [[internet of things]] and [[augmented reality]] platforms.{{cite web|url=https://www.ptc.com/en/news/2017/ptc-appoints-dr-corinna-lathan-to-its-board-of-directors|title=PTC Appoints Technology Innovator Dr. Corinna Lathan to Its Board of Directors|date=17 August 2017|publisher=''PTC''|accessdate=22 January 2018}} Dedicated to empowering women and minorities in science and technology, Lathan founded Keys to Empowering Youth (KEYs) in 1993 at [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology|MIT]], which has since been adopted at other universities nationwide.{{cite web| url = https://psc25.mit.edu/inspirations/keys#.WmY1R6inFPY | title = KEYs | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''MIT Public Service Center''}} She is an advisor to the [[For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology|FIRST]] and [[VEX Robotics Competition|VEX]] robotics programs and a Board Member at [[KID Museum]].{{cite web| url = http://kid-museum.org/who-we-are/board-members/ | title = Board Members | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''KID Museum''}} Previously, Lathan was an Advisory Board Member of Amman Imman - Water is Life, a judge for Qualcomm Tricorder [[X Prize Foundation|XPRIZE]],{{cite web| url = https://tricorder.xprize.org/about/judges | title = Judges | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''Tricorder XPRIZE''}} and a Board Member of the National Black Child Development Institute. == Recognition == * [[Daily Record (Maryland)|The Daily Record]] Maryland’s Top Innovator of the Year (2002) * [[MIT Technology Review]] Top 100 World Innovators (2002) * [[World Economic Forum]] Technology Pioneer (2004){{cite news| url = http://mtech.umd.edu/news/press_releases/anthrotronix_tech_pioneer.html | title = TAP Graduate AnthroTronix Inc. Named Technology Pioneer for 2004 by World Economic Forum | date = 12 December 2003 | accessdate = 22 January 2018 | publisher = ''Maryland Technology Enterprise Institute''}} * [[World Economic Forum]] Young Global Leader{{Cite journal|last=Salim|first=Nancy|date=June 2009|title=Changing the World, One Robot at a Time|url=|journal=IEEE Women in Engineering|volume=|pages=20–22|via=}} * [[Fast Company (magazine)|Fast Company Magazine]] Most Creative People in Business (2010) == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.anthrotronix.com AnthroTronix] * {{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2013/05/07/180331008/envisioning-the-future-with-cori-lathan|title=Envisioning The Future With Inventor Cori Lathan|publisher=|accessdate=28 November 2017}} * McCarthy, Ellen, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/ac2/wp-dyn/A36745-2003Dec28?language=printer 'AnthroTronix Puts Robotics to Work for Disabled Children and Soldiers in Combat'], ''[[The Washington Post]]'', 2003. * Taboh, Julie, [http://www.voanews.com/english/news/usa/people/sociallyassitverobots08Dec2009-78761362.html 'Robot Helps Children with Disabilities'], [[Voice of America]], 2009. {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lathan, Corinna E.}} [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Swarthmore College alumni]] [[Category:Women in engineering]] [[Category:American roboticists]] [[Category:Women computer scientists]] [[Category:Massachusetts Institute of Technology alumni]]

MicroSD slot (comes with 2 GB MicroSD SDXC, upgradable to 64 GB) | power = 3 W @ 5 V, 2 A DC | weight = ~91 g | dimensions = 55 × 55 × 42 mm }} '''CuBox''' and '''CuBox-i''' are series of small and fanless [[nettop]]-class computers manufactured by the Israeli company [[SolidRun]] Ltd. They are all [[Cube|cube-shaped]] and sized at approximately 2 × 2 × 2 inches and weigh 91 grams (0.2 lb, or 3.2 oz).http://www.cnx-software.com/2013/09/05/solidrun-announces-cubox-i-platform-with-freescale-i-mx6-for-as-low-as-45/ SolidRun Announces Cubox-i Platform with Freescale i.MX6 for as low as $45. CuBox was first announced in December 2011 and began shipping in January 2012, initially being marketed as a cheap open-source developer platform for [[embedded systems]].[http://www.geek.com/articles/chips/cubox-is-a-sexy-ice-cube-sized-arm-computer-20111221/ CuBox is a sexy, ice cube-sized ARM computer].[http://www.crazyengineers.com/cubox-ice-cube-sized-arm-computer-1465/ CuBox – Ice Cube Sized ARM Computer].[http://archive.linuxgizmos.com/android-ready-arm-mini-htpc-costs-130-uses-just-three-watts/ Android-ready ARM mini-HTPC costs $130, uses just three Watts].[http://www.cnx-software.com/2011/12/14/solid-run-cubox-open-source-platform-for-android-tv-media-center-and-nas-development/ Solid-Run CuBox: Open Source Platform for Android TV, Media Center and NAS Development].[http://coburndomain.org/index.php/2011/12/move-raspberry-pi-cubox-enters-fray-1gb-ddr3-ram-dualcore-cpu-hdmi-gbit-lan-cubed-box/ Move over Raspberry Pi: CuBox enters the fray with 1GB DDR3 RAM, dualcore CPU, HDMI, GBit LAN… all inside a cubed box].[http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/12/meet-cubox-a-tiny-arm-powered-media-centre-capable-of-running-ubuntu/ Meet CuBox – A Tiny ARM Powered Media Centre Capable of Running Ubuntu]. The first-generation CuBox was according to SolidRun the first commercially available desktop computer based on the [[Marvell Technology Group|Marvell]] Armada 500-series [[System on a chip|SoC (System-on-Chip)]] and at the time was said to be the world's smallest desktop computer.[http://www.myxnews.com/2011/12/solid-run-cubox-worlds-smallest-htpc.html Solid-Run CuBox: World's Smallest HTPC (video)]. In November 2013, SolidRun released the Cubox-i1, i2, i2eX, and i4Pro, containing [[I.MX#i.MX6x series|i.MX6]] processors.{{cite web |url=http://www.solid-run.com/festive-day-at-solidrun-pre-orders-of-cubox-i-packed-and-ready-for-shipping/ |title=CuBox-i Series Release |accessdate=2014-07-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140714213918/http://www.solid-run.com/festive-day-at-solidrun-pre-orders-of-cubox-i-packed-and-ready-for-shipping/ |archivedate=14 July 2014 |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web |url=http://www.solid-run.com/wiki/CuBox-i_Hardware |title=CuBox-i Hardware |accessdate=2014-07-11 }}{{dead link|date=August 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==Overview== CuBox is a low-power computer based on [[ARM architecture|ARM-architecture]] [[Central processing unit|CPU]], using the Marvell Armada 510 (88AP510) SoC with an ARM v6/v7-compliant superscalar processor core, [[Vivante]] GC600 [[OpenGL]] 3.0 and [[OpenGL ES]] 2.0 capable 2D/3D [[graphics processing unit]], Marvell vMeta HD Video Decoder hardware engine, and [[ARM architecture#Security extensions (TrustZone)|TrustZone]] security extensions, [[Cryptographic Engines and Security Accelerator]] (CESA) co-processor.[http://linuxdevices.linuxgizmos.com/marvell-expands-range-of-arm-socs/ Marvell expands range of ARM SoCs]. Despite being about 2-inch-square in size, the platform can stream and decode [[1080p]] content, use desktop-class interfaces such as [[KDE]] or [[GNOME]] under Linux, while requiring less than 3 watts and less than 1 watt in standby.{{youtube|twEoMYEJls4|XBMC on SolidRun Platform named CuBox}}. SolidRun currently officially only supports [[Linux kernel]] 2.6.x or later and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.2.x and later. It comes with [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu Desktop]] 10.04 and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.2 dual-boot pre-installed. ==Newer models== In November 2013, SolidRun released a family of CuBox-i computers named CuBox-i1, i2, i2eX, and i4Pro, containing a range of different [[I.MX#i.MX6x series|i.MX6]] processors by [[Freescale Semiconductor]].{{cite web |url=http://www.solid-run.com/festive-day-at-solidrun-pre-orders-of-cubox-i-packed-and-ready-for-shipping/ |title=CuBox-i Series Release |accessdate=2014-07-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140714213918/http://www.solid-run.com/festive-day-at-solidrun-pre-orders-of-cubox-i-packed-and-ready-for-shipping/ |archivedate=14 July 2014 |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web |url=http://www.solid-run.com/wiki/CuBox-i_Hardware |title=CuBox-i Hardware |accessdate=2014-07-11 }}{{dead link|date=August 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} They have also released a series of caseless i.MX6 models called the Hummingboard.{{cite web |url=http://www.solid-run.com/double-dip-double-delicious/ |title=Hummingboard Release |accessdate=2014-07-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140714213917/http://www.solid-run.com/double-dip-double-delicious/ |archivedate=14 July 2014 |df=dmy-all }} ==CuBoxTV== Announced in December 2014, CuBoxTV is a mid-range and simplified version of the CuBox-i computer. It is designed to exclusively operate [[Kodi (software)|KODI]] (formerly known as XBMC) on an [[OpenELEC]] [[operating system]].{{cite news|last1=Lehrbaum|first1=Rick|title=Hands-on review: CuBoxTV running OpenELEC+Kodi and Android|url=http://linuxgizmos.com/hands-on-review-cuboxtv-running-openelec-kodi-and-android/|accessdate=4 June 2015|work=LinuxGizmos.com|date=20 December 2014}} CuBoxTV weighs approximately 9.9[[Ounce|oz]] (281 grams), and is around 2X2 Inches wide and 1.8 inches high, shaped like a cube with rounded sides. It features an [[I.MX#i.MX6x series|i.MX6]] [[Quad core]] processor at a 1GHz speed, 1GB of [[RAM]] memory, 8GB base storage memory and a GC2000 [[OpenGL]] quad shader [[GPU]]. It houses a couple of [[USB]] 2.0 ports, a [[HDMI]] port, [[microSD]] port and an [[Ethernet]] port.{{cite web|title=CuBoxTV Tech Specs|url=http://cuboxtv.com/|website=CuBoxTV.com|accessdate=4 June 2015}} ==Similar products== {{main|Comparison of single-board computers}} * [[BeagleBoard]] (and BeagleBone), [[Cotton Candy (single-board computer)|Cotton Candy]], [[MiniEMBWiFi]], [[PandaBoard]], [[Raspberry Pi]], [[Trim-Slice]], [[Utilite]] ==See also== {{Portal|Computing|Education}} * [[Industrial PC]] * [[Single-board computer]] * [[Home theater PC]] * [[ARM architecture]] ==References== {{Reflist|35em}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://solid-run.com/}} * [http://cuboxtv.com/ CuBoxTV product page] {{Linux mini computers}} [[Category:Computer-related introductions in 2011]] [[Category:Linux-based devices]] [[Category:Computers and the environment]] [[Category:Nettop]] [[Category:Embedded Linux]] [[Category:Single-board computers]] [[Category:Educational hardware]] [[Category:ARM-based home computers]]

{{Infobox company | name = Cybozu Inc. | logo = | logo_size = 200px | type = [[Kabushiki gaisha]] | industry = [[Software]] | founded ={{Start date and age|1997|08|08}} in [[Matsuyama]], [[Ehime]], [[Japan]] | founders = [[Toru Takasuka]], Yoshihisa Aono, Shinya Hata | hq_location_city = Tokyo | hq_location_country = Japan | traded_as ={{tyo|4776}} | subsid = {{Unbulleted list|Cybozu Research Institute Inc.|Cybozu Labs, Inc.|Cybozu IT Shanghai Inc.|Cybozu Vietnam Co., Ltd.|kintone Corporation}}<ref>https://cybozu.co.jp/company/copyright/en/corporate_profile.pdf</ref> | website = [https://cybozu.co.jp Japanese] [https://www.kintone.com English] }} {{nihongo|'''Cybozu, Inc.'''|サイボウズ株式会社|Saibōzu Kabushikigaisha}} is a [[Tokyo]]-based software company that provides web-based [[groupware]] services including '''Cybozu''' Office and kintone. In addition to the main office in Tokyo, Cybozu also has offices in Matsuyama and [[Osaka]], as well as several overseas subsidiaries in countries including [[Vietnam]],<ref>https://cybozu.vn</ref> [[China]],<ref>https://www.cybozu.cn</ref> [[Australia]]<ref>https://www.kintone.com.au</ref> and the [[United States]].<ref>https://www.kintone.com/build-applications-platform/</ref> The U.S.-based subsidiary, '''kintone Corporation''', is located in [[San Francisco, California]].
== Background == In 1997, [[Toru Takasuka]] resigned as the Vice President/Director of [[Matsushita Electric Works]] V-Internet Operations, an in-house venture company he helped to create. Along with partners Yoshihisa Aono and Shinya Hata, he started the software company in [[Matsuyama, Ehime]] with a $200,000 loan from family and friends. The company aimed to produce Japan’s first web-based [[groupware]] products. Cybozu, Japanese for “cyber-kid”, rapidly gained market share in the Japanese market. Within three years the company went public – at that time the fastest company rise to [[IPO]] in the history of Japan’s 2nd section of the [[Tokyo Stock Exchange]].<ref>http://thebridge.jp/en/2013/07/cybozu-to-enter-us-market</ref> Today Cybozu is the number one groupware producer in Japan. They are currently listed on the 1st section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
Cybozu prides itself on having a corporate culture that enables its employees to have a healthy [[work-life balance]].<ref>http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/11/24/national/social-issues/workforce-shrinks-career-walls-japans-women-crumbling/#.WRkNKVI9y9Y</ref> In 2017, Cybozu was listed by Great Place to Work as the number one mid-sized Japanese company for women.<ref>http://hatarakigai.info/ranking/woman/#ranking_02</ref>
Released in 2011, Cybozu's low code/no code platform known as kintone<ref>https://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonbloomberg/2016/06/12/cloud-expo-conference-short-on-innovation-still-provides-value/#3ce18d7b4db0</ref> was recognized by the [[Gartner]] [[Magic Quadrant]] for Enterprise Application Platform as a Service (aPaaS) in both 2016 and 2017.<ref>https://www.gartner.com/doc/3263917/magic-quadrant-enterprise-application-platform</ref> It was also listed by CIO Applications as one of the 25 Workflow Solutions Transforming Businesses in 2016.<ref>http://www.prweb.com/releases/2016/05/prweb13407212.htm</ref> In November 2013, Cybozu along with Zendesk launched their joint marketing efforts at the cybozu.com conference on cloud computing in Tokyo.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/11/06/zendesk-and-japanese-saas-provider-cybozu-announce-product-integration-and-marketing-deal/|title=Zendesk And Japanese SaaS Provider Cybozu Announce Product Integration And Marketing Deal|last=Shu|first=Catherine|work=TechCrunch|access-date=2017-10-26|language=en}}</ref>

{{Infobox software | name = Docebo | logo = | developer = Docebo S.p.A. | latest release version = 7.5 | latest release date = {{start date and age|2018|10|11}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | programming language = [[PHP]] | size = | genre = [[Learning management system]] | license = GPL v2.0 | website = {{URL|docebo.com}} }}
'''Docebo''' is a [[software as a service]] artificial intelligence platform for [[e-learning]], also known as a [[learning management system]].<ref name="Silicon">{{cite web|url=http://siliconvalley.corriere.it/2012/03/21/la_nuova_italia_che_avanza_doc/|title=La nuova Italia che avanza: Docebo|publisher=Corriere Della Sera|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref><ref name="Open">{{cite web|url=http://barrysampson.com/2009/04/open-source-lms-10-alternatives-to-moodle/|title=10 Alternatives to Moodle|publisher=Open Source|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref><ref name="Dynamic">{{cite web|url=http://dynamicinventions.com/docebo|title=Docebo LMS|publisher=Dynamic Inventions|accessdate=2014-01-23|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140220045633/http://dynamicinventions.com/docebo/|archivedate=2014-02-20|df=}}</ref><ref name="Wired">{{cite web|url=http://italianvalley.wired.it/news/2012/02/10/docebo-elearning-cloud-19867.html|title=Docebo spinge l’e-learning nella nuvola|publisher=Wired.IT|accessdate=2014-01-23|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131211111255/http://italianvalley.wired.it/news/2012/02/10/docebo-elearning-cloud-19867.html|archivedate=2013-12-11|df=}}</ref><ref name="Business">{{cite web|url=http://www.businesscommunity.it/m/_Aprile2013/fare/Docebo_trasformare_la_formazione_in_un_servizio.php|title=Docebo: trasformare la formazione in un servizio|publisher=Business Community|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref> Established in 2005, Docebo (Latin for "I will teach") offers a learning portal for companies and their employees, partners and customers.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.klass.com/portfolio_page/docebo/|title=Docebo {{!}} Klass Portfolio|work=Klass|access-date=2017-06-12|language=en-US}}</ref> Docebo is compatible with [[Sharable Content Object Reference Model|SCORM]] 1.2 and 2004 as well as [[XAPI (e-learning)|Tin Can]].<ref name="Open"/> Developed by Docebo Srl, the program was originally released under a [[General Public License|GPL]] V. 2.0 license with no licensing costs. The program now operates as a cloud-hosted software as a service platform as well as being third-party compatible. It currently runs version 7.5.<ref name="CVEDetails">{{cite web|url=https://www.docebo.com/knowledge-base/weeklychangelog70/|title=Docebo Weekly Changelog|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Docebo|accessdate=2017-06-12}}</ref> The company using the platform loads a course, creates a username and password for employees, and tracks the progress of its users.<ref name="Digitali">{{cite web|url=http://blog.indigenidigitali.com/startupid-claudio-erba-di-docebo/|title=Claudio Erba di Docebo|publisher=Indigenidigitali|accessdate=2014-01-23|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201205501/http://blog.indigenidigitali.com/startupid-claudio-erba-di-docebo/|archivedate=2014-02-01|df=}}</ref> Docebo is available in more than 40 languages.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.trainingindustry.com/suppliers/d/docebo.aspx|title=Docebo - Supplier Profile {{!}} Training Industry|website=www.trainingindustry.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref> While the primary users of Docebo are midsized companies, it is also assessable for large companies and [[Small and medium enterprises|SMEs]].<ref name="Digitali"/><ref name="Repubblica">{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/economia/affari-e-finanza/2013/09/30/news/docebo_come_vendere_le-learning_agli_americani-67555597/|title=Docebo come vendere l’e-learning agli americani|publisher=Economia & Finanza|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref><ref name="Economy">{{cite web|url=http://www.economyup.it/innovazione/390_docebo-l-e-learning-made-in-italy-che-viaggia-nel-mondo.htm|title=Docebo, l'e-learning made in Italy che viaggia nel mondo|publisher=EconomyUP|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref> Docebo also has their platform being used for external enterprise training.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/enterprise-lms-corporate-learning-management-system/|title=Extended Enterprise LMS {{!}} AI Enterprise Learning Management System|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref>
In 2016, 2017 and 2018, Docebo was named by PCMag as "the best online learning platform for business on the market."<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=https://www.pcmag.com/review/345255/docebo|title=Docebo|website=PCMAG|language=en|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pcmag.com/roundup/345257/the-best-online-learning-platforms-for-business|title=The Best Online Learning Platforms for Business in 2018|work=PCMAG|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en}}</ref>
In October 2018<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/press/docebo-launches-artificial-intelligence/|title=Docebo 7.5 Debuts Artificial Intelligence Sparking The Future Of Enterprise Learning - Docebo|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref>, Docebo released their learning-specific artificial intelligence algorithms into the learning platform that are powered by a combination of machine learning, deep learning and natural language processing to produce an automated and holistic approach to learning (formal LMS, experiential and social) that drives growth, organizational performance, and revenue.
== Product == With Docebo Learn (LMS)<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/learning-management-system-lms/|title=Learning Management System (LMS) - Docebo AI Learning Platform|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref>, enterprises have the ability to centralize and organize courses, distribute and manage online and instructor-led courses, track certifications and measure results with dashboards and custom analytics. Docebo Learn (LMS) is powered by AI, automatically tagging learning content and making it easier to find.
Docebo also provides accompanying modules to Docebo Learn include Docebo Coach & Share<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/corporate-lms-formal-informal-social-learning/|title=Coach & Share – Docebo AI Social Learning Platform|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref> (AI Powered Social Learning)''',''' enabling learning in the flow of work with informal and experiential learning opportunities and Docebo Perform<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/perform-skills-management-system/|title=Docebo Perform: A skills management system to identify and close skill gaps|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref> (skills gap management), helping organizations empower their people through skills gap analysis and improving employee competencies with targeted learning programs based on the current and future skills need of your business.
==History==
Docebo was founded in 2005 by Claudio Erba, who continues to lead the company as CEO.<ref name="Silicon"/><ref name="Repubblica"/> Erba had previously been working at the [[University of Florence]] as a [[information technology consulting|computer consultant]] when a customer asked for a storage solution for teaching material.<ref name="Lastampa">{{cite web|url=http://www.lastampa.it/2013/09/23/tecnologia/docebo-con-il-cloud-elearning-rivoluziona-il-mercato-della-formazione-aziendale-online-I7ZcrY72RtmCgNiNOITtgN/pagina.html|title=Docebo con il "Cloud E-Learning" rivoluziona il mercato della formazione aziendale online|publisher=La Stampa|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref> The storage solution evolved into what is now Docebo.<ref name="Lastampa"/>
In 2012, Docebo received its first round of funding from Italian venture capital firm Principia SGR.<ref name="Wired"/><ref name="Repubblica"/> Later that same year, Docebo opened an office in Athens, Georgia.<ref name="Repubblica"/><ref name="Lastampa"/>
Docebo's second venture-backed financing round came from Canadian firm Klass Capital in 2016, funding its continued North American expansion with the opening of an office in Toronto, Ontario.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://techvibes.com/2015/02/12/klass-capital-docebo-2015-02-12|title=E-Learning Platform Raises $3 Million from Toronto VC Firm to Enter Canadian Market|website=Techvibes|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref>
== Awards == <!--Please focus on significant major awards in independent media and organizations. Avoid PR publications and trivial polls.--> * 2015 Brandon Hall Group's Best Advance in Unique Learning Technology (Silver)<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://brandonhall.com/excellence-technology.php?year=2015|title=Brandon Hall Group|website=brandonhall.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref> * 2015 Brandon Hall Group's Best Advance in Learning Management Technology (Bronze)<ref name=":4" /> * 2016 PCMag.com Editors' Choice<ref name=":1" /> * 2016 Brandon Hall Group's Best Advance in Learning Management Technology (Gold)<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.brandonhall.com/excellenceawards/excellence-technology.php?year=2016|title=Past Winner - Excellence in Technology|website=www.brandonhall.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref> * 2016 Brandon Hall Group's Best Advance in Unique Learning Technology (Bronze)<ref name=":2" /> * 2016 Talented Learning's Best All-Purpose Extended Enterprise LMS (Top 3)<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://talentedlearning.com/best-lms-2016-talented-lms-vendor-awards/|title=Best LMS? 2016 Talented Learning LMS Vendor Awards - Talented Learning|date=2016-12-07|work=Talented Learning|access-date=2017-06-12|language=en-US}}</ref> * 2016 Talented Learning's Best LMS Thought Leader (Top 3)<ref name=":3" /> * 2017 Brandon Hall Group's Best Strategy for a Corporate Learning University, with Cineplex (Silver)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.brandonhall.com/excellenceawards/excellence-learning.php?year=2017|title=Past Winners - Excellence in Learning|website=www.brandonhall.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-19}}</ref> * 2017 Brandon Hall Group's Best Advance in Creating a Learning Strategy, with Datto (Gold)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.brandonhall.com/excellenceawards/excellence-learning.php?year=2017|title=Past Winners - Excellence in Learning|website=www.brandonhall.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-19}}</ref> * 2017 Fosway Core Leader in the Fosway 9-Grid for Learning Systems<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.fosway.com/9-grid/learning-systems/|title=Learning Systems|work=Fosway Group, Europe's number one HR, digital learning and talent management analyst|access-date=2017-06-12|language=en-GB}}</ref> *2018 PCMag.com Editors' Choice<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pcmag.com/roundup/345257/the-best-online-learning-platforms-for-business|title=The Best Online Learning Platforms for Business in 2018|work=PCMAG|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en}}</ref> *2018 FeaturedCustomer.com Market Leader <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.featuredcustomers.com/customer_success_report/summer-2018-corp-lms|title=Featured Customers Success Report|last=|first=|date=|website=FeaturedCustomers.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> *2018 GetApp Category Leader <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.getapp.com/education-childcare-software/learning-management-system-lms/#getrank|title=GetApp's Top Learning Management System (LMS) Category Leaders|website=GetApp|language=en|access-date=2018-10-24}}</ref>

{{Infobox company | name = FastSpring | logo = File:FastSpring logo.png | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | industry = [[SaaS]] | foundation = 2005 | founder = Ryan Dewell, Dan Engel, [[Jason_Foodman|Jason Foodman]], Ken White | location_city = [[Santa Barbara, California]] | area_served = Global | key_people = {{bulleted list| Chris Lueck <small>(CEO)</small> | Mike Smith <small>(CTO)</small> | Ben Knoll <small>(CFO)</small> | Scott Halstead <small>(SVP Marketing & Business Development)</small>}} | products = {{Unbulleted list| [[Electronic Software Distribution]] | E-Commerce Platform | Recurring Billing | Subscription Management | Subscription Billing}} | homepage = [http://www.fastspring.com www.fastspring.com] }}
'''FastSpring''' is a [[SaaS]] company that offers a [[subscription billing service]] & [[eCommerce]] platform for [[SaaS]], [[software]] and other digital product & service companies to monetize their products and services online. The Company's technology provides an end-to-end payment processing, subscription management & fulfillment solution for companies that develop [[SaaS]], [[software]], [[digital media]], [[video games]], [[e-books]] and more.
== History ==
Founded in 2005, the company is based in [[Santa Barbara, CA]]. In March 2011, FastSpring launched its subscription management and recurring billing solution.<ref>{{cite news | author = Rip Emerson | title = Online Subscription Billing Is Still a Hassle, SaaSy Aims to Change That | newspaper = TechCrunch | date = March 17, 2011 | url = https://techcrunch.com/2011/03/17/online-subscription-billing-is-still-a-hassle-saasy-aims-to-change-that/ | accessdate = 18 September 2013 }}</ref> The company received its first outside investment in April 2013 for an undisclosed amount from [[Pylon Capital]].<ref>{{cite news | title = FastSpring Receives Significant Investment from Pylon Capital | newspaper = The Wall Street Journal | date = April 24, 2013 | url = https://www.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20130424-914738.html | accessdate = 18 September 2013}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news | author = Sarah Perez | title = All-In-One E-Commerce Solution FastSpring Takes Its First Outside Investment From Pylon Capital | newspaper = TechCrunch | date = April 24, 2013 | url = https://techcrunch.com/2013/04/24/all-in-one-e-commerce-solution-fastspring-takes-its-first-outside-investment-from-pylon-capital/ |accessdate = 18 September 2013}}</ref>
FastSpring was recognized for a Silver Stevie Award for Customer Service Department of the Year in 2013<ref>{{cite web|title= 2013 Customer Service Awards Category Stevie Award Winners|url=http://www.stevieawards.com/pubs/iba/awards/408_2913_24122.cfm|publisher=Stevie Awards, Inc.|accessdate=18 September 2013}}</ref> and again in 2014<ref>{{cite web|title= 2014 Customer Service Awards Category Stevie Award Winners|url=http://www.stevieawards.com/pubs/iba/awards/408_2942_24961.cfm|publisher=Stevie Awards, Inc.|accessdate=2 September 2014}}</ref> and 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title= 2015 Stevie Award Winners|url=http://stevieawards.com/sales/2015-stevie%C2%AE-award-winners|publisher=Stevie Awards, Inc.|accessdate=27 July 2016}}</ref>

{{orphan|date=June 2010}} [[File:GO-ESSP_logo.png |thumb|alt='GO-ESSP logo']] The '''Global Organization of Earth System Science Portals''' or (''GO-ESSP'') is an international collaboration, formed in 2003, that is developing software infrastructure to support the distribution, and analysis of [[climate model]] data and related observations.<ref>{{cite conference | author = D. Williams | title = The Global Organization for Earth System Science Portals and the Earth System Grid Center for Enabling Technologies | year = 2009 | booktitle = Global Interoperability Program Kickoff Meeting | location = Princeton, NJ | url = http://gip.noaa.gov/presentations/pres_0911_kickoff_goessp.pdf }}</ref><ref name="JOF782007">{{cite journal|title=Building a Global Federation System for Climate Change Research: The Earth System Grid Center for Enabling Technologies (ESG-CET)|journal=Journal of Physics|publisher=IOP Publishing|issue=Conference Series 78 (2007) 012050|url=http://www.iop.org/EJ/article/1742-6596/78/1/012050/jpconf7_78_012050.pdf?request-id=349b7342-b0eb-431b-9b27-e4d9857813bd}}</ref>
GO-ESSP is playing a central role in coordinating United States and European efforts to document and distribute data for the 5th [[coupled model intercomparison project]], which will be part of the [[IPCC Fifth Assessment Report]].

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2015}} {{Use British English|date=August 2015}} {{Infobox artefact | name = Germain Service | image = Baixela Germain - Centro de Mesa (cropped).png | image_caption = The ''[[surtout de table]]'' of the Germain Service | material = Silver | size = | writing = | created = 1750s-60s | discovered = | location = [[National Museum of Ancient Art]], [[Lisbon]] | id = | registration = }} The '''Germain Service''' is an 18th-century [[tableware]] set comprising more than a thousand pieces in cast, raised, and chiselled silver, made in the workshop of French silversmith [[François-Thomas Germain]] for the Portuguese royal family. This service is now on permanent exhibition as part of the collection of the [[National Museum of Ancient Art]], in [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]].
The service was commissioned by [[Joseph I of Portugal]] in 1756, just after the [[1755 Lisbon earthquake]], in an attempt to renew the splendor of the royal court (as the earthquake had, in the words of Royal Jewel Keeper António Pinto da Silva, "[reduced] ''to ashes all treasure and tapestries of the Royal Household, sparing nothing''"); there were, however, troubles in the consignment of the service: in 1765, Germain declared bankruptcy and the order was left unfinished (which precipitated the Portuguese Crown to start a legal dispute to reclaim the loss of the goods, to no avail).<ref name="Jardim">{{cite book |last=Jardim |first=Maria do Rosário |date=2012 |title=A Baixela Germain ao serviço da Corte no Reinado de D. Maria I |trans-title=The Germain Service in the service of the court during the reign of Maria I |url=http://palacioajuda.pt/Data/Documents/Artigos/A%20Baixela%20Germain%20ao%20servi%C3%A7o%20da%20Corte.pdf |language=Portuguese |location=Lisbon |publisher=[[Palace of Ajuda|Palácio Nacional da Ajuda]] - Artigos em Linha (n.º 6) |isbn=}}</ref> One of the most expressive elements of a great [[Service à la française|''à la française'' service]] was missing: the fourth-course ''[[surtout de table|surtout]]''. Still, the Germain Service was considered the ''First Service'' of the Crown, to which was added the service confiscated from the [[Duke of Aveiro]] in 1759 (the ''Second Service'') — they both made up "all necessary tableware" for court feasts.<ref name="Jardim"/>
The Germain Service was used publicly for the first time during the ceremonies of the [[Coronations in Europe#Portugal|Acclamation]] of [[Maria I of Portugal|Queen Maria I]], the daughter of Joseph I, on 13 May 1777.<ref name="Virgolino1777">{{cite book |last=Virgolino |first=António Pedro |date=1777 |title=Auto do Levantamento e Juramento que os Grandes, Títulos Seculares, Ecclesiasticos, e mais Pessoas que se acharão prezentes fizerão à Muito Alta e Muito Poderoza Rainha Fidelíssima, A Senhora Dona Maria Primeira, Nossa Senhora na Coroa destes Reinos e Senhorios de Portugal; sendo exaltada e coroada sobre o Regio Throno juntamente com o Senhor Rey Dom Pedro Terceiro na tarde do dia treze de Mayo, Anno de 1777 |trans-title=Act of the Accession and Oath that the Grandees, Secular Titled Nobility, Ecclesiastics, and more People in attendance sweared to the Most High and Most Powerful, Most Faithful Queen Maria the First, Our Lady in the Crown of these Kingdoms and Dominions of Portugal; as she was exalted and crowned under the Royal Throne together with King Peter the Third, in the afternoon of the thirteenth of May, in the Year 1777 |url=http://digitarq.arquivos.pt/details?id=4617845 |language=Portuguese |location=Lisbon |publisher=[[Torre do Tombo National Archive|Arquivo Nacional da Torre do Tombo]] - Códices e documentos de proveniência desconhecida, n.º 180 |isbn=}}</ref>
In 2006, the Germain Service was made part of the [[Ministry of Culture (Portugal)|Ministry of Culture]]'s list of Portuguese National Treasures.<ref>{{cite act |title=Decreto n.º 19/2006 de 18 de Julho |trans-title= |type=Decree |number=19/2006 |language=Portuguese |date=18 July 2006 |article= |article-type= |page= |url=https://dre.pt/pesquisa/-/search/537265/details/maximized}}</ref>
== Gallery == {{Gallery |title=Pieces from the Germain Service |width=160 | height= |align=center |File:Baixela Germain - Terrina.png |[[Tureen]] |File:Baixela Germain - Pots-à-oille.png |''Pot-à-oille'' |File:Baixela Germain - Saleiros.png |[[Salt and pepper shakers|Salt pots]] |File:Baixela Germain - Especieiro.png |Spice pots |File:Baixela Germain - Base de Galheteiro.png |[[Cruet-stand]] |File:Baixela Germain - Cafeteiras e Chocolateira.png |[[coffee pot|Coffee and cocoa pots]] }}

[[File:Bohrturm-Erbendorf.jpg|thumb|The drill tower of the main borehole]] The '''German Continental Deep Drilling Program''' (in German: '''{{lang|de|Kontinentales Tiefbohrprogramm der Bundesrepublik Deutschland}}'''<ref>literally: "Continental deep-drilling program of the Federal Republic of Germany"</ref>), abbreviated as the '''KTB''' borehole, was a [[scientific drilling]] project carried out from 1987 to 1995 near [[Windischeschenbach]], Bavaria. The main super-deep borehole reached a depth of 9,101 meters in the [[Continental crust|Earth's continental crust]].
The [[Federal Ministry of Education and Research (Germany)|Federal Ministry of Research]] funded the project with 528 million [[Deutsche Mark|DM]] (270 million Euros). The Lower Saxony LBEG mining office (State Office for Mining, Energy and Geology) took the project lead. After the drilling project ended, the German Research Centre for Geosciences used the borehole to install a seismic deep observatory ({{lang|de|Tiefenobservatorium}}) which was active from 1996 to 2001. The [[derrick]] used at the site, one of the largest in the world, remains in place and has become a tourist attraction. The two boreholes were kept open for further scientific research.
== History == In October 1986 the German Minister for Research and Technology (Bundesminister für Forschung und Technologie), Dr. H. Riesenhuber, officially announced that the super-deep borehole of the Continental Deep Drilling Program of the Federal Republic of Germany (KTB) would be drilled in the Upper Palatinate area of Northern Bavaria. This site was selected against an alternative proposed site in the Black Forest area based on recommendations made by the [http://www.dfg.de/en/ Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG)]. These were based on evaluations of the technical and financial risks by the project management team. The site recommendation and selection was preceded by a conference held from September{{nbs}}19 to 21, 1986 in Seeheim/Odenwald. Results of the site studies in the Upper Palatinate and the Black Forest were presented and discussed there. Immediately following the conference and evaluation of scientific and technical models and targets, members of the DFG Senate Commission for Geoscientific Interdisciplinary Research voted almost unanimously for the Oberpfalz site. In presenting their decision, the DFG Senate Commission emphasized that while the Upper Palatinate site was favoured in the vote, both locations offered a number of positive research objectives and that both locations were potentially suitable sites for research drilling.
== Results == The KTB project utilized several innovations to drill design. The [[Kola Superdeep Borehole|Kola drilling experiment]] had had problems with high friction that was increased by the vertical instability when drilling to such depths. German scientists designed a new drill head which would maintain direction with a minimal lateral difference. The drill head was also designed to withstand temperatures between {{convert|250|and| 300|°C|°F}}. The original expectations had been that this temperature would be reached at a depth of about 10 to 14 kilometers. This is also the reason why the Upper Palatinate site was chosen. The Black Forest site had been considered suitable from a scientific view, but it was expected to have a higher temperature gradient. At the Upper Palatinate location, however, it was hoped to reach the {{lang|de|Erbendorfkörper}} – a deep-lying mass that is believed to be on the boundary of a former continental plate and is identified by its characteristic reflection of seismic waves.
Even though the {{lang|de|Erbendorfkörper}} was not reached, the KTB drilling was widely considered a success. For one thing, the temperature rose much more quickly than expected. This caused discussion and a reformulation of theories about the [[geothermal gradient|temperature gradient]] of very deep drill holes. Other theory changes were also required – it had been expected that the large tectonic pressures and high temperatures would create [[metamorphic rock]]. Unexpectedly the rock layers were not solid at the depths reached. Instead large amounts of fluid and gas poured into the drill hole. Due to the heat and fluids, the rock was of a dynamic nature which changed how the next super-deep drilling needed to be planned.
The experiments at the KTB produced interesting results. The initial seismic tests showed very different recordings compared to those near the surface so that the theories on the source of seismic reflections needed to change. Using the data, the reflections from depth could be interpreted better even when initiated from the surface.
The first experiment, the {{lang|de|"Dipole-Dipole Experiment"}} measured the electric conductibility around the drill hole. This showed lines of graphite spanning through the rocks that allowed the rocks to slide when under sufficient pressure. The second experiment was to exert high pressure in the drill hole such that the rock would start cracking, the {{lang|de|"Integriertes Hydrafrac/Seismik Experiment"}}. The resulting seismic activity was measured at multiple stations in the area. The conclusion was that the overall pressure came from the south, the African tectonic plate at work. The third experiment, the {{lang|de|"Fluid/Hydraulik-Test}}," pumped large amounts of fluid into the rock which proved it to be generally porous.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://scinexx.de/dossier-detail-56-11.html |title=Was die Wissenschaftler fanden: Ergebnisse der KTB |first=Marcus |last=Anhäuser |work=Scinexx |date=21 December 2001 |language=de}}</ref>
These experiences were the foundation of the follow-up project, the [[International Continental Scientific Drilling Program]] (ICDP) founded in 1996. The German scientists of the KTB were also called to help with the [[San Andreas Fault Observatory at Depth]] drill hole.
